metadata.Title: CVE-2023-28531 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
ssh-add in OpenSSH before 9.3 adds smartcard keys to ssh-agent without theintended per-hop destination constraints. The earliest affected version is8.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28531` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5
openssh-server - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5
openssh-sftp-server - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5
openssh-tests - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5
ssh - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5').
